intro: Ficinia nuda, commonly known as the naked fig, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Moraceae family, which includes other familiar plants like the common fig. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate or elliptical in shape. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, fleshy fruits. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Ficinia nuda is considered a rare and lesser-known species within its family.
